title: 108_s1582
content: The Act titled "Valles Caldera Preservation Act of 2004" includes amendments to the Valles Caldera Preservation Act. The Valles Caldera Preservation Act of 2004 includes amendments related to the acquisition of outstanding mineral interests by the Secretary on a willing seller basis. The Valles Caldera Preservation Act of 2004 includes amendments related to the acquisition of outstanding mineral interests by the Secretary. The amendments involve the removal of certain phrases, the addition of new clauses regarding administration and available funds, and the declaration of taking if negotiations fail. The Valles Caldera Preservation Act of 2004 allows the Secretary to acquire interests if negotiations fail. Any difference in compensation will be paid from a judgment appropriation. The Valles Caldera Preservation Act of 2004 allows the Trust to determine obligations and expenditures, following laws applicable to Government corporations. The Valles Caldera Preservation Act allows the Trust to determine obligations and expenditures, as well as solicit donations and use proceeds accordingly. The Valles Caldera Preservation Act allows Trustees, the executive director, and one additional employee to solicit donations. Proceeds can be used from claims, judgments, or settlements related to activities on the Baca Ranch or the Preserve after October 27, 1999. The Valles Caldera Preservation Act allows Trustees, the executive director, and one additional employee to solicit donations. Proceeds can be used from claims, judgments, or settlements related to activities on the Baca Ranch or the Preserve after October 27, 1999. SEC. 3. BOARD OF TRUSTEES. Section 107(e) of the Valles Caldera Preservation Act (U.S.C. 698v-5(e)) is amended to specify the selection and compensation of the chair of the Board of Trustees. The chair of the Board of Trustees may be compensated at a rate determined by the Board, not exceeding the annual rate of pay for level IV of the Executive Schedule. The chair of the Board of Trustees can be compensated up to 25% of the annual rate of pay for level IV of the Executive Schedule under title 5, United States Code. SEC. 4. RESOURCE MANAGEMENT. Property Disposal Limitations amended under the Valles Caldera Preservation Act to include restrictions on disposal duration and termination. The Valles Caldera Preservation Act is amended to include restrictions on disposal duration, termination, and exclusions for real property. Law enforcement and fire management provisions are also updated. The Valles Caldera Preservation Act is amended to include provisions for the sale or disposal of renewable resources. Law enforcement and fire management sections are also updated. The Valles Caldera Preservation Act is amended to include provisions for fire management, specifically regarding non-reimbursable services for fire preparedness, suppression, and emergency rehabilitation. The Secretary, in consultation with the Trust, will develop a plan for fire preparedness, suppression, and emergency rehabilitation services on the Preserve, consistent with the management program. The Secretary will provide services under a cooperative agreement with the Trust for fire preparedness, suppression, and emergency rehabilitation on the Preserve. The Secretary may provide reimbursable presuppression and nonemergency rehabilitation services for the Trust under a cooperative agreement. The Senate passed the bill on September 15, 2004. Attest: EMILY J. REYNOLDS, Secretary.
